```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, eval = TRUE, fig.align = "center", warning = F, message = F,
tidy=TRUE, tidy.opts=list(width.cutoff=60), R.options=list(max.print=100))

class_diag <- function(score, truth, positive, cutoff=.5){

  pred <- factor(score>cutoff,levels=c("TRUE","FALSE"))
  truth <- factor(truth==positive, levels=c("TRUE","FALSE"))

  tab<-table(truth, pred)
  acc=sum(diag(tab))/sum(tab)
  sens=tab[1,1]/rowSums(tab)[1]
  spec=tab[2,2]/rowSums(tab)[2]
  ppv=tab[1,1]/colSums(tab)[1]

#CALCULATE F1
  f1=2*(sens*ppv)/(sens+ppv)
  
#CALCULATE EXACT AUC
  truth<-as.numeric(truth=="TRUE")
  ord<-order(score, decreasing=TRUE)
  score <- score[ord]; truth <- truth[ord]
  TPR=cumsum(truth)/max(1,sum(truth))
  FPR=cumsum(!truth)/max(1,sum(!truth))
  dup<-c(score[-1]>=score[-length(score)], FALSE)
  TPR<-c(0,TPR[!dup],1); FPR<-c(0,FPR[!dup],1)
  n <- length(TPR)
  auc<- sum( ((TPR[-1]+TPR[-n])/2) * (FPR[-1]-FPR[-n]) )
  round(data.frame(acc,sens,spec,ppv,f1,ba=(sens+spec)/2,auc, row.names = "Metrics"),4)
}
```

```{R}
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)

Variants <- read.delim("https://www.dropbox.com/s/yz7e8npx8jb0ub3/Variants.csv?dl=1", sep = " ")

Variants$PhenotypeList <- str_remove(Variants$PhenotypeList, "not specified")
Variants$PhenotypeList <- str_remove(Variants$PhenotypeList, "not provided")
Variants$PhenoCount <- ifelse((str_detect(Variants$PhenotypeList, "conditions")==TRUE), yes= (PhenoCount = (str_extract(Variants$PhenotypeList, "[0-9]+ conditions"))), no=(PhenoCount = str_count(Variants$PhenotypeList, "[a-zA-Z0-9]+[^|]+")))
  
Variants <- Variants %>%  mutate(Size = Stop - Start + 1) %>%
select(c(Type, GeneSymbol, ClinSigSimple, PhenoCount, Chromosome, Size)) %>% 
  distinct() %>% 
  na.omit() %>% 
  filter(Chromosome!="na") %>% filter(ClinSigSimple!="-1")

Variants$PhenoCount <- str_remove(Variants$PhenoCount, "conditions") %>% as.numeric

Del <- Variants %>% filter(Type=="Deletion") %>% select(-Type)

```

### Cluster Analysis

```{R}
library(cluster)

DelGower <- Del %>% select(!c(GeneSymbol)) %>% mutate_if(is.character, as.factor) %>% daisy(metric="gower") 

sil_width<-vector()
for(i in 2:30){  
  fit <- pam(DelGower, diss = TRUE, k = i)   
  sil_width[i] <- fit$silinfo$avg.width  
}
ggplot()+geom_line(aes(x=1:30,y=sil_width)) + scale_x_continuous(name="k",breaks=1:30)
#From the peak at 9, it appears 9 clusters is the ideal cluster number
```
